'''Noctowl''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ヨルノズク''' ''Yorunozuku'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Hoothoot}} starting at [[level]] 20.

==Biology==
[[File:Wings Alexander Noctowl.png|200px|left|thumb|Wings Alexander's Noctowl]]
Noctowl bears similarity to an owl with brown plumage and has a darker brown triangle pattern of feathers running down its chest. Its wings and wedge-shaped tail are dark brown, while the undersides of its wings are light brown. It has bushy, cream-colored feather 'horns' that look similar to a {{wp|trident}} or {{wp|eyebrows}}. The ring pattern around its eyes and its talons are cream colored, and Noctowl's beak and talons are light pink. Additionally, Noctowl has large, red eyes. As shown in [[EP223|the anime]], Noctowl can grow a small beard in its elderly stages.

Noctowl is a [[nocturnal Pokémon]], and has eyes that can see in pitch-darkness. Called "the emperor of dark nights" by some, it never lets its prey escape. It has exceptional hearing and eyesight, can fly silently, and can turn its heads at a 180° angle to increase its intellect. It can also turn its head upside down, which signals that it is troubled by something. Noctowl is most commonly found nesting in trees and {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}. It pecks those who disturb it.
{{left clear}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Ornithol Noctowl.png|thumb|left|250px|Noctowl in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Ash Noctowl.png|thumb|left|250px|{{Shiny}} Noctowl in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Noctowl]]====
Noctowl debuted in ''[[EP154|Fowl Play!]]''. A man was trying to capture the smaller, {{shiny}} Noctowl with traps, but kept failing due to the Owl Pokémon's intelligence. After {{TRT}} was sent flying, the Noctowl allowed {{Ash}} to have the chance to capture it. After an intense battle, Ash succeeded.

====Other====
[[Wings Alexander]] has a Noctowl, as seen in ''[[EP223|Throwing in the Noctowl]]''. For most of the episode, it was sleeping in the plane but flew out to help Ash's Noctowl when the flight encountered problems.

A Noctowl appeared in ''[[XY077|A Relay in the Sky!]]'', under the ownership of [[Ornithol]].

===Minor appearances===
Several wild Noctowl appeared in ''[[EP154|Fowl Play]]''.

A Noctowl appeared in ''[[EP227|For Ho-Oh the Bells Toll!]]'', ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]'', and ''[[DP100|Aiding the Enemy!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Noctowl appeared in ''[[AG175|Going for Choke!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Contest Battle|Battle Stage]] of the {{ci|Mulberry}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Noctowl appeared in ''[[DP118|Pursuing a Lofty Goal!]]'', under the ownership of a participant of the [[Squallville]] [[PokéRinger]]. It was used against a {{p|Fearow}}.

A Noctowl appeared in Meowth's fantasy in ''[[BW119|Meowth, Colress and Team Rivalry!]]''.

Multiple Noctowl appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Falkner Noctowl Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Noctowl in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Noctowl under [[Falkner]]'s ownership was first seen alongside its Trainer when he first appeared in ''[[PS099|Sunkern Treasure]]'' while trying to catch a {{p|Skarmory}}.

{{adv|Crystal}} mentioned that she captured a Noctowl on her way to Professor Elm's Lab in ''[[PS118|Three Cheers for Chikorita]]''.

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'', a Noctowl was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

Multiple Noctowl appeared in ''[[PAXY28|Scizor Defends]]'' and ''[[PAXY33|Chesnaught Protects]]'' as Pokémon in the [[Pokémon Village]].

==Trivia==
*Noctowl was the first Shiny Pokémon to appear in the anime.

===Origin===
Noctowl's appearance is based on that of the {{wp|Horned owl}}.

====Name origin====
Noctowl is a combination of ''{{wp|nocturnal}}'' and ''{{wp|owl}}''.

Yorunozuku is a combination of 夜 ''yoru'' (night) and 木菟 ''mimizuku'' ({{wp|horned owl}}).
